other_tests.findings: Baseline Hamilton ratings during the premenstrual phase without treatment were 25 and 28; subsequent scores improved to 10 after treatment with bright light.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Hamilton scores decreased from 30 to 10 after one week of bright light therapy and increased to 32 during the placebo trial.

other_tests.findings: Low melatonin profiles in the patient compared to published normal values; slight delay in the onset of melatonin secretion in the premenstrual phase compared to the follicular phase.
Hamilton score decreased from 25 to 5 with 80 mg of propranolol; 40 mg also effectively reduced depressive symptoms (score changed from 37 to 15).
Atenolol (50 mg/day) was effective, reducing the Hamilton score from 25 to 11.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During the placebo trial, the patientâ€™s Hamilton score increased from 28 to 35 in the premenstrual period.
